name: Closed-Loop Transfer Function
explanation: Closed-loop systems use feedback to control output. T(s) is the overall system transfer function where G(s) is the plant (system being controlled) and H(s) is the feedback path. The denominator 1 + G(s)H(s) determines stability. Feedback reduces sensitivity to disturbances and improves accuracy. Most control systems use closed-loop feedback for better performance.

examples.problem: Plant G(s) = 10/s, feedback H(s) = 1. What is closed-loop transfer function?
Why is closed-loop better than open-loop?
examples.solution: Feedback compensates for disturbances and model errors
